edu.biu.protocols.yao.common

Class Preconditions

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.protocols.yao.common.Preconditions

  • public class Preconditions
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides some pre-checks that can be used in the protocol.
    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Asaf Cohen)

        Checks if the given expression is not null. If the expression is null, the function throws an exception.

      • checkIntegerInRange

        public static void checkIntegerInRange(int i,
                       int min,
                       int max)
        Checks if the given index is between the given min and max values. If not, the function throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        i - The index to check.
        min - The minimum value that the index can be.
        max - The maximum value that the index can be.

      • checkIndexInRange

        public static void checkIndexInRange(int i,
                     int upperBound)
        Checks if the given index is below the given upper bound. If not, the function throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        i - The index to check.
        upperBound - The maximum value that the index can be.

      • checkBinary

        public static void checkBinary(int i)
        Checks if the given value is a binary value (e.g. 0/1). If not, the function throws an exception.
        Parameters:
        i - The value to check.
